greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 3*k - 2 interleaved with 3*k - 1 and 3*k.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: A permutation of the natural numbers: 3*k - 2 interleaved with 3*k - 1 and 3*k; k=1,2,3,...; given a(1) = 1. a(n) = n if the subset = 3*k - 1: (2, 5, 8,...); a(n) = n+1 in 3*k - 2, k>1: (4, 7, 10, ...); and a(n) = (n-1) in 3*k: (3, 6, 9,...).
For n>1, a(n) = n+2*sin(2*(n+1)*Pi/3)/sqrt(3). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 27 2017
maple: A143097 := proc(n) if(n<=1)then return n: elif(n mod 3 <= 1)then return n+1-2*(n mod 3): else return n: fi: end: seq(A143097(n), n=1..70); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 30 2011
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 24 2008
